paragraph.paragraph: This wizardwill generatethe requested HTML documentation for all or part of you compiled ENViSioN! project.
paragraph.heading: 2Page content
paragraph.paragraph: The wizard comprises of the following pages:
paragraph.heading: 2Requirements
paragraph.paragraph:
TheHTML Report Wizard requires that you use a compiled Eiffel ENViSioN! project. For the best results ensure that you compile in the release configuration mode, or a configuration mode that has the
/10_Developing\20_Managing_Projects\10_Configuring_A_Project\10_Project_Property_Pages\general_ppg.xmlOptimizeCode Optimize Code project property set in the
/10_Developing\20_Managing_Projects\10_Configuring_A_Project\10_Project_Property_Pages\general_ppg.xml General property page
.
paragraph.heading: 2 Introduction
paragraph.paragraph: The HTML Report Wizard will generate a set of HTML documents corresponding to the selected clusters you wish to document. A Table of Contents (TOC) will also be generated with these files.
paragraph.heading: 2Select Eiffel ENViSioN! Project
paragraph.paragraph: The first step of the wizard is to select the Eiffel ENViSioN! project you want to generate your report documentation for. Enter an Eiffel ENViSioN! project file (eifp) full path into Project File or click Browse to browse for a file on disk. Once you have select a file you can move on the next step by clicking Next.
paragraph.heading: 2Select Project Configuration
paragraph.paragraph: The wizard now requires the configuration you wish to generate your projects report documentation for. Select the desired configuration name from the Configurations list and click Next to continue.
paragraph.heading: 2 Select Clusters
paragraph.paragraph: You may generate documentation for all or a subset of the clusters in your Project. TheSelect Clusterpage allows you to selectyour project's configurationclusters containing those classes to generate the documentation for.

The Excluded Clusterslist is the list of clusters that will not have documentation generated for them and the Included Clusters list will. You can include/exclude clusters using one of the four selection buttons <<, <, > or >>.

list.item: <: Exclude only those selected clusters in the Included Clusters list.
>: Include only those selected clusters in the Excluded Clusters list.

paragraph.heading: 2Generate Documentation
paragraph.paragraph: Now that you have configured the HTML Report Wizard to generate the desired amount of documentation for the selected project configuration, click Finish to generate the documentation in the choosen path and complete the wizard.
